intro: Pinus oocarpa var. manzanoi, commonly known as the Manzánito pine, is a variant of the Mexican pine native to the Sierra Madre de Oaxaca in Mexico. It is a medium-sized evergreen conifer characterized by its slender, pyramidal crown and long, needle-like leaves. The tree produces distinctive cone clusters, which are typically reddish-brown and contain small, edible seeds. Its bark is thick and fissured, providing structural support and protection against environmental stress. This species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various wildlife species and contributing to local biodiversity.
